2024.question:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct regarding the array data structure?

(a) Arrays allocate memory in contiguous memory locations.
(b) Arrays are the only data structure capable of implementing stacks.
(c) Arrays are homogeneous.
(d) Arrays store elements in non-contiguous memory locations.
(e) A two-dimensional array is logically an array of arrays.
options: Arrays allocate memory in contiguous memory locations.
Arrays are the only data structure capable of implementing stacks.
Arrays are homogeneous.
Arrays store elements in non-contiguous memory locations.
A two-dimensional array is logically an array of arrays.
2024.explanation: Arrays use contiguous memory and hold elements of the same type (homogeneous). Multi-dimensional arrays are represented as arrays of arrays.

2024.question: What is the minimum number of stack operations (Push and Pop) required to reverse the contents of a queue of size n using a single stack?
options: n
2n
3n
2024.explanation: To reverse a queue using a stack: 1. Dequeue n elements and Push them to stack (n stack pushes). 2. Pop n elements from stack and Enqueue them back to queue (n stack pops). Total stack operations = n + n = 2n.

2024.question:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct regarding linked lists?

(a) Accessing the nth element has O(1) time complexity.
(b) Circular linked lists are used in round-robin scheduling.
(c) In a circular doubly linked list, it is impossible to determine the start.
(d) In a doubly linked list, the last node always points back to the head.
(e) In a singly linked list, the next pointer of final node points to NULL.
options: (a) Accessing the nth element has O(1).
(b) Circular linked lists are used in round-robin.
(c) Circular doubly linked: impossible to determine start.
(d) Doubly linked: last node points to head.
(e) Singly linked: final node points to NULL.
2024.explanation: Linked lists have O(n) access time. Circular lists are ideal for scheduling. Standard singly linked lists end with a NULL pointer.

2024.question: Which of the following is/are valid applications of stacks?
options: Back button in a web browser.
Delimiter checking.
Evaluation of a postfix expression.
Implementing BFS in a graph.
Undo/redo functionality.
2024.explanation: Stacks are LIFO structures used for recursion, undo/redo, browser history, and expression evaluation. BFS uses a Queue (FIFO).
Tracing the recursive calls: fun(4) calls fun(3)... result is '0 1 2 0 3 0 1'.
